author: Staff Reporter
text:
The wholesale price of egg has dropped by 18 paise to be fixed at Rs. 3.34 here on Saturday.

Officials at the National Egg Coordination Committee (NECC), Namakkal Zone, said that the price drop is due to drop in consumption due to intense heat prevailing in North India and summer setting in other States. They said that production remains the same, but there is a drop in the demand. Officials said that price fall is expected for the next three months and normalise only in June.

On February 1, the wholesale price of egg was Rs. 4. But the price dropped to Rs. 3.70 on February 6 and to Rs. 3.52 on February 25. The average price of egg for February is Rs. 3.72 where as it was Rs. 3.94 for January.
title: Wholesale price of egg drops
